cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles SSE of Nassau and 325 miles SE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest across the Bahamas, then turning north-northwest and skirting very near the Florida east coast before lifting toward Georgia and South Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Very near the Florida east coast between West Palm Beach and Cape Canaveral (close-pass rather than direct landfall)

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Fernandina Beach, FL to Edisto Beach, SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Golden Beach, FL to Fernandina Beach, FL including Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast from Deerfield Beach through Fernandina Beach, with surge and hurricane-force winds spreading northward
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds expected early Thursday morning, strengthening to hurricane conditions (possibly Category 4 intensity) Thursday night through Friday with gusts well over 74 mph.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 3–5 ft above ground possible along the Palm Beach County shoreline if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Forecast 4–7 inches with locally up to 10 inches, creating flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very dangerous surf and rip currents; possible port-side pier/berth damage from large battering waves.
